image.altText: Travis Lovett stands in the ruins of Lake Condah mission.

props.synopsis: Australia has a painful past. For the first time, the country has been grappling with recording the stories of that history in a truth-telling commission.

title.children: These crimes were hidden for generations. Now Australia's having a moment of truth

image.altText: Emergency services parked next to a dam on a rural property.

props.synopsis: Ambulance Victoria has confirmed that a young child has drowned in a dam near Nagambie in Victoria's north.

title.children: Toddler drowns on rural property in Victoria's north

image.altText: A woman with a blonde bob smiles in her kitchen while showing off a jar of pickled carrot peels

props.synopsis: Rebecca Buckley is getting creative to keep food on the table amid skyrocketing expenses. As more people face food insecurity in the cost-of-living crisis, researchers warn it can lead to disordered eating.

title.children: Rebecca went from survival mode to self-care when facing food insecurity

image.altText: A mock up of a train on the Suburban Rail Loop

props.synopsis: Federal minister Clare O'Neil says the Victorian government has to explain its funding needs beyond the $2 billion it has promised for the state's $34.5 billion rail loop project.

title.children: Federal government asks for explanation of Victoria's Suburban Rail Loop funding plan

image.altText: CCTV video of an attempted kidnap

props.synopsis: Police are appealing to the public to help identify a young male who attempted to kidnap a woman after she got off a bus in suburban Melbourne on Wednesday night.

title.children: Attempted kidnapping of Melbourne woman walking home prompts public appeal

image.altText: Origin energy img

props.synopsis: Australia's largest energy retailer Origin has been fined more than $17 million for breaches of Victoria's energy rules affecting hundreds of thousands of customers.

title.children: Origin Energy fined $17m for Victorian energy rule breaches

image.altText: Image of a close-up of rice grains.

props.synopsis: Rice feeds billions daily, but it also fuels climate change. Scientists are pioneering new techniques to cut emissions and make rice farming more sustainable.

title.children: Rethinking a tiny grain could help fight climate change

image.altText: A baby marmoset sitting on a green towel.

props.synopsis: Documents obtained under freedom of information laws show how marmosets and macaques are bred and experimented on at a regional Victorian facility to improve medical outcomes for humans.

title.children: Inside a Victorian university lab where monkeys are bred for testing

image.altText: A man with sandy hair and beard in a fleece-lined grey coat and checked shirt leans against a window that shows his reflection.

props.synopsis: After battling alone with the stigma of family sexual abuse, Travis found a community thanks to a new form of group therapy in Melbourne.

title.children: Travis was a 'healthy, active teenager' when his life was 'stolen'

image.altText: A man and woman posing for a photo on a stage

props.synopsis: ABC reporters Danny Tran, Stephanie Ferrier, Harrison Tippet and Rebecca Symons were among the winners at Victoria's annual journalism awards night.

title.children: ABC journalists in the limelight at annual Quill Awards in Melbourne

image.altText: Lily Alford feeds Prince, her seeing eye dog.

props.synopsis: Lily Alford lives a rich and busy life — the 24-year-old wheelchair user says none of it would be possible without guide dog Prince by her side.

title.children: This guide dog went back to school for wheelchair training

image.altText: A police officer stands at a camera tripod in front of a crime scene and police car.

props.synopsis: An 18-year-old man has been charged with murder after an alleged fatal stabbing in Melbourne's south-east last week.

title.children: Melbourne teenager charged with murder after alleged stabbing

image.altText: A dimly lit pokies room with bright colourful lights coming from each of the machines.

props.synopsis: Two years after the Murphy Inquiry handed down its recommendations for gambling reform, nothing has been done. One former addict and gambling advocates want it talked about in the lead-up to the federal election.

title.children: Former addict and advocates want gambling reform discussed before election

image.altText: Several people holding down a teenage boy in an aeroplane

props.synopsis: The identities of foreigners a 17-year-old may have spoken to before allegedly trying to hijack a Jetstar plane will be kept secret for at least three months.

title.children: Names of foreigners suppressed in case of teen accused of plane hijack attempt

image.altText: Orange scooters parked on a CBD street on a grey overcast day.

props.synopsis: The future of e-scooter hire in Melbourne has been thrown into doubt after two major operators withdrew services from an inner Melbourne council.

title.children: Council expects e-scooter companies to return with 'tail between legs'

image.altText: A construction site

props.synopsis: A report released by independent body Infrastructure Australia says it has low confidence in the cost estimate for the Victorian government's multi-billion-dollar signature rail project.

title.children: Suburban Rail Loop will cost more than what Victoria budgeted for, report warns

image.altText: A red brick school building with manicured lawns and gardens.

props.synopsis: A prestigious private school in regional Victoria says boys have been expelled after an investigation into student-on-student violence at the school's boarding house.

title.children: Ballarat Grammar expels students over assaults

image.altText: Festival-goers watch a performance on the stage during the day at Meadow Festival.

props.synopsis: One of the most acclaimed contemporary indie musicians in the world will play this festival in Victoria's south-west on the weekend, but it will be the event's final run as it becomes yet another Australian festival to succumb to financial pressures.

title.children: Joining a long list of shuttered festivals, a local favourite calls time

image.altText: An aerial view of houses in Melbourne.

props.synopsis: With rents rising, one landlord says the real estate industry needs to be scrutinised while the Real Estate Institute of Victoria proposes land tax reforms to help alleviate pressure on housing providers offering long-term leases.

title.children: Landlord says real estate agents 'culpable' in Victoria's housing crisis

image.altText: black and white horse with her mane braided

props.synopsis: A cherished therapy horse feared stolen from a Central Victorian property has been found unharmed by police.

title.children: Woman who incorrectly reported therapy horse as stolen 'mortified' by mistake

image.altText: Person getting arrested with handcuffs

props.synopsis: Victorian bail reforms, including scrapping remand as a last resort for youth offenders, will become law after the legislation passed both houses of parliament in a sitting that stretched late into last night.

title.children: Legal groups slam new Vic bail laws as 'dangerous and discriminatory'

image.altText: A photo of a power point at a wall with three black cords plugged in and the power turned on.

props.synopsis: The company behind the proposed transmission project says it is more feasible and has more farmer support than two controversial projects.

title.children: 250km underground power transmission line plan for Victoria

image.altText: A composite image of a man wearing an AFL vest with his arms crossed and a woman in a soccer shirt holding a ball.

props.synopsis: For professional athletes, an injury can be devastating. Lydia Williams and Bob Murphy share how they moved past the pain.

title.children: Two sporting legends share how they moved past injuries to reach new heights

image.altText: A small bowl of plain elbow pasta next to a red squeeze bottle.

props.synopsis: Parents say they are being lied to about the quality of food at childcare centres across the country. Some say they were promised in-house chefs but children were served "two-minute noodles".

title.children: Childcare centres feeding children for as little as 33 cents a meal

image.altText: Three Hawthorn AFL players celebrate a goal against the Blues.

props.synopsis: Undefeated through their opening three matches, the Hawks are not getting carried away with their start to the season, which continued with a gritty 20-point win over the Blues at the MCG.

title.children: 'Not our best performance': Hawks want improvement despite unbeaten start

image.altText: Police tape at a crime scene

props.synopsis: Victoria's crime rate rose by more than 13 per cent last year, with the number of criminal incidents reaching record levels. Police say youth crime and thefts from vehicles are driving the increase.

title.children: Crime rate in Victoria hits 'unacceptable' high, driven by young offenders

image.altText: Two police cars are parked in the middle of a street which is taped off with police tape.

props.synopsis: A Victorian magistrate has extended a violent teenager's time behind bars, saying the community needs to be protected from the 15-year-old boy.

title.children: Community needs to be protected from violent 15yo boy, says magistrate

image.altText: Four Penrith NRL players stand in a group after loss to Melbourne Storm.

props.synopsis: After playing much of the match without Nathan Cleary, the Panthers still find positives in their 30-24 loss to the Storm in Melbourne.

title.children: Panthers not panicking after second straight loss in premiership defence

image.altText: A digital render of a train station at Melbourne Airport.

props.synopsis: The Federal government, state government and Melbourne Airport have signed a Memorandum of Understanding to commence delivery of the Airport Rail Link project but would not confirm a completion date.

title.children: MoU a 'significant' commitment to Melbourne Airport Rail Link, govt says

image.altText: Chimneys from Scarborough's Pluto gas facility with flames coming from them.

props.synopsis: Gas consumption in Australia is falling faster than anticipated, helping to avoid the risks of seasonal shortages in the next few years, according to energy commentators.

title.children: Looming gas crisis averted as Australian use plummets

image.altText: Eight books, including a picture book, and a manuscript arranged against a while wall and yellow floor.

props.synopsis: The winners of this year's Victorian Premier's Literary Awards have been announced, with the list dominated by independent presses and First Nations writers.

title.children: Growing up, Wanda got old dresses for Xmas. Her book about it just won $125k

image.altText: A photo of Sol overlaid on a photo of a two bathroom stalls - one for women and one for men.

props.synopsis: With universities and sports stadiums installing gender-inclusive bathrooms, Australia is considering making changes to make it easier to do so. We unpack what the proposed changes would mean.

title.children: Australia considering making changes to build all-gender bathrooms

image.altText: The exterior of the Supreme Court of Victoria.

props.synopsis: Armed with knives and a cricket bat, two "delusional" teenagers with plans to take over Australia killed a defenceless mother in a frenzied rage, a Victorian court has been told.

title.children: Mother stabbed to death after teens hatched national takeover plan, court told

image.altText: GettyImages-2197719456

props.synopsis: Holly McNamara is set to play a starring role in Melbourne City's AFC Women's Champions League quarterfinal against Taiwanese club Taichung Blue Whale.

title.children: Rising Matildas talent talks 'huge emotional toll' of repeated ACLs

image.altText: A close up of a brown male wedge-tailed eagle.

props.synopsis: Aptly named, Storm the wedge-tailed eagle has been released back into the wild more than a year after being injured in wild weather in Victoria.

title.children: Storm the wedge-tailed eagle returns to skies after feather transplant
